page.title: 02A FAVOURITE LOCAL WALK
page.content: From our Yate school we can walk into the survey area.We leave our houses behind,cross the railway line and reach Wapley Common.We can see that most of the area is farmland and Wapley church looks very pretty on top of the hill.Walking up the quiet lane we can see horses,sheep and cows in the fields.The houses and church have different tiles, some stone, others slate or pottery. The church has a metal footscrape and steel support in its tower.It is lovely to sit in the shade of the trees in the churchyard. Touching the church walls and closing our eyes it feels all rough like sandpaper.Nearby is the old school house and a disused water pump in the field.It is a lovely walk from Yate to Wapley and many of us go there with family or friends.
